name: Chaski Framework
tagline: Lightweight Framework for Wi-Fi Tethering in Android
body:
Chaski is a minimalistic framework to enable communication between off-the-shelf Android devices via common Wi-Fi (802.11 Infrastructure Mode). 

![chaskiSymbol](https://github.com/chaski-framework/chaski-framework.github.io/blob/master/images/chaskiSymbol.png)

###Documentation
You can find a detailed documentation on getting started with Chaski in the [Wiki](https://github.com/chaski-framework/chaski/wiki).

### Authors
* [Amro Al-Akkad](https://github.com/alakkad)
* Any contributors :)

### License
The Chaski Framework is licensed under the Apache License, version 2.0. See the files in the top-level of the [Chaski distribution](https://github.com/chaski-framework/chaski) called LICENSE.txt and NOTICE.txt.
